text: [Music]
hey guys it's Molly
today on frosted I'm gonna be making a
coffee crunch cake it pairs a light
sponge cake with a rich coffee frosting
and some very cool coffee candy on top
[Music]
this is a very simple cake to make I've
got some cake flour in here and I'm
gonna add some sugar some baking powder
and some salt give this a nice whisk
make sure everything is incorporated
next we have our wet ingredients I'm
gonna start with some water don't really
have to worry about everything mixing
together right now I've got some oil
some vanilla and I've got our egg yolks
and you'll see what I'm gonna be doing
with our egg whites in just a second
give this a nice mixing until it's all
incorporated here the volume from this
cake comes from whipping the egg whites
until they're stiff peaks and folding
them in that gives a lot of air in our
batter which is going to create a really
nice rise
[Music]
our egg whites
once you get to this point where it's
really nice and foamy start to sprinkle
sugar in its a little bit at a time
want to give the sugar a chance to
incorporate itself
summers in here take it outside
[Applause]
what you're looking for here is nice
glossy stiff peaks so when you pull it
up like this if there's no jury bench
down here you just want it to stick
right up so this is exactly what we want
right here start with just a little bit
of your whipped egg whites don't worry
about folding this in just incorporate
this now we can do this in two let's do
half at a time this folding technique is
just pulling from the bottom and lifting
over to the top we're really hoping not
to lose any volume here so even with a
few streaks we're gonna add the rest of
it so we don't want to touch this more
than we need to and we're using a two
pan here if I get a two pin that has a
feed because you cool these cakes upside
down and otherwise we're going to put a
bottleneck on here and turn it upside
down a little you don't need to grease
this pan because this batter needs
something to hold on to so that it rises
as much as possible so we don't want it
slipping down the sides of the pan from
butter or oil it goes right into the pan
as is just smooth out the top pop any
little air bubbles that you see don't
fuss with it too much and get this right
into the oven bake it until it's golden
very high and spring back to the touch
now we're gonna make our coffee frosting
it's just whipped cream with some very
strongly brewed coffee i brewed a really
nice espresso here make sure that your
coffee is very cold because you don't
want it to melt your whipped cream so
start off with some cream in a blender
and we're gonna whip this to stiff peaks
[Music]
once your cream is quite viscous you can
start to sprinkle in your sugar we're
using superfine sugar here because we
really want to make sure that all the
sugars as well
okay come stop that and pour in your
coffee here and then just mix that until
it incorporates so here's our coffee
whipped cream and you want to make sure
that it's really stiff because it has to
hold all of the coffee candy that we're
gonna make max so throw this in the
fridge while we make our candy you start
with some sugar some more strongly
brewed coffee and some corn syrup give
this a mix and using a candy thermometer
wait until this gets to 300 degrees once
you mix everything together
don't touch it again let it rise to
temperature on its own and meanwhile get
the rest of your stuff ready because the
next step happens very fast
we have reached 300 degrees here and
very quickly we're going to sift some
baking soda and we're going to mix this
until it's just incorporated and then
pour this down what you don't want to do
is spread it once it's on the pan
so whatever organic shape it takes is
the organic shape you will get let this
cool for about 30 minutes and then we're
going to our coffee crunch candy is nice
and firm and now we get to have a look
fun break some up with your hands
depending on the kind of size that you
want but you want a little bit of
everything here and you can see that
it's nice and light and spongy and
crunchy it's an interesting texture but
it's very fun this looks great look at
this beautiful cake it is so high here's
our it's a very rustic looking cake so
don't think about this too much all we
want to do is cover it once you get the
whole thing covered you can kind of play
around with some texture in your
frosting if you notice I put some
parchment underneath this cake right
here because I had it directly on the
pizza but I didn't want to dirty it so
after we frost it we'll pull this off
and you'll be left with a nice clean
edge
[Music]
now you can kind of play around with
some little squiggles or scoops however
you feel like decorating this guy don't

for that right now it's just time to

and really you can do this any way you
like it's kind of a crazy cake but it's
fun it's unique this cake is unlike

I can guarantee it it's got a light airy
and lofty cake with a rich creamy coffee
flavor
and a crunchy coffee candy topping it's

it's definitely worth trying
